coach
Class CoachLabIIplus

java.lang.Object
  coach.CoachLabIIplus

public class CoachLabIIplus
extends java.lang.Object

Title: CoachLabIIplus

Description: EJS Element for CoachLabIIplus, a multifunctional interface for computerized measurement and control.

Version:
May 2012

Implemented sensors in this version:

Identification Description
10 0135i Thermocouple (-20 .. 110 °C)
12 0135i Thermocouple (-200 .. 1300 °C)
20 0663i Force Sensor (-5 .. +5N)
22 0663i Force Sensor (-50..+50N)
30 024i Magnetic Field sensor (-10 .. 50 mT)
32 024i Magnetic Field sensor (-100 .. 500 mT)
41 0222i Differential Current sensor (-500 .. +500mA)
51 0210i Differential Voltage sensor (-10 .. +10V)
Author:
Francisco Esquembre, Andres Mejias, Marco Marquez

times

Constructor Detail

CoachLabIIplus

public CoachLabIIplus()
Method Detail

setupCoach

public void setupCoach(java.lang.String com,
                       int baudRate)
Setup and initialization of CoachLabII+

Parameters:
com - serial port
baudRate - This specifies the desired baud rate as follows:
  • 2400
  • 9600
  • 19200
  • 38400
  • 57600
  • 115200
  • 230400 bd
  • 500000 bd
  • 300 (833333 bd) (Cygnal, aliased)
  • 600 (1250000 bd)(Cygnal, aliased, outside specification)
Note.: CoachLab-II+ starts at a baud rate of 833333 bd.

setupCoach

public void setupCoach(java.lang.String com)
initializes CoachLabII+ at 8333333 bd (default)

Parameters:
com - serial port

stop

public void stop()
Stops data communication on the port.

delay

public void delay(int t)
Specifies a delay (in milliseconds)

Parameters:
t - time (milliseconds)

reboot

public void reboot()
Soft power-on reset of CoachLabII+

setMeasurement

public void setMeasurement(int numPointsperChannel,
                           double totalSampleTime,
                           int[] sensorTypes,
                           int triggerChannel,
                           int triggerSensorType,
                           double triggerLevel,
                           int triggeUpDown,
                           int hysteresis)
Set the necessary parameters to configure the measure with 4 sensors

Parameters:
numPointsperChannel - Number of points per channel
totalSampleTime - Sample time of the measurement
sensorTypes - Types of sensors used (see list of sensors)
triggerChannel - Channel used for triggering (0 = no trigger)
triggerSensorType - Type of sensor used for triggering (see list of sensors)
triggerLevel - Trigger level (in magnitude --Nw, V, mT...-- of triggering sensor)
triggeUpDown - Direction of triggering (0 -> UP, 1 -> DOWN)
hysteresis - the value of hysteresis (from 0 to 127)

singleReading

public double singleReading(int channel,
                            int sensorType)
Reads an analog channel (single reading)

Parameters:
channel - channels 1 - 4 of CoachLabII+
sensorType - The type of the sensor:
Returns:
Normalized value of the measurement (V, N, A, mT...)

readOneSensor

public double[] readOneSensor(int channel,
                              int numPoints,
                              double totalSampleTime,
                              int sensorType,
                              boolean trigger,
                              double triggerLevel,
                              int triggeUpDown,
                              int hysteresis)
Read one sensor with triggering and hysteresis (all optional)

Parameters:
channel - the channel (1-4)
numPoints - Points to sample from sensor
totalSampleTime - Total time of sample
sensorType - Type of the sensor (see list of sensors)
trigger - true = trigger on
triggerLevel - Trigger level (magnitude)
triggeUpDown - trigger direction (0 -> UP, 1 -> DOWN)
hysteresis - The value of hysteresis (from 0 to 127)
Returns:
The sampled data from sensor in an array

initTime

public void initTime()
Calculates the initial time

deltaTime

public long deltaTime()
Time interval from initial time

Returns:
Time interval (milliseconds) from initTime

enableOutput

public void enableOutput(int outputNumber)
Enable an output of CoachLabII+

Parameters:
outputNumber - Output number (0 to 7):

ind | Output of CLII+

  • 0 -------> A1
  • 1 -------> A2
  • 2 -------> B1
  • 3 -------> B2
  • 4 -------> C1
  • 5 -------> C2
  • 6 -------> D1
  • 7 -------> D2

disableOutput

public void disableOutput(int outputNumber)
Disable an output of CoachLabII+

Parameters:
outputNumber - Output number (0 to 7):

ind | Output of CLII+

  • 0 -------> A1
  • 1 -------> A2
  • 2 -------> B1
  • 3 -------> B2
  • 4 -------> C1
  • 5 -------> C2
  • 6 -------> D1
  • 7 -------> D2

enableOutputFor

public void enableOutputFor(int outputNumber,
                            double time)
Set all outputs from 0 to outputNumber ON for time ms.

Parameters:
outputNumber - output (0-7)
time - in milliseconds (max value: 52 seconds)

enableOutputMask

public void enableOutputMask(int mask)
Enable outputs. Outputs which correspond to a '1' in the mask are set; outputs corresponding with a '0' in the mask will remain unchanged.

Parameters:
mask - Integer from 0 to 255

disableOutputMask

public void disableOutputMask(int mask)
Disable outputs. Outputs which correspond to a '1' in the mask are reset; outputs corresponding with a '0' in the mask will remain unchanged.

Parameters:
mask - Integer from 0 to 255

setPWM

public void setPWM(int outputNumber,
                   int level)
Set PWM level Outputs are dutycycled with a frecuency of 625 Hz in 16 levels The lower three bits define the output that is set (0-7), the highest 4 bits determine the duty cicle: 0 = 1/16,... 15=16/16

Parameters:
outputNumber - *

ind | Output of CLII+

  • 0 -------> A1
  • 1 -------> A2
  • 2 -------> B1
  • 3 -------> B2
  • 4 -------> C1
  • 5 -------> C2
  • 6 -------> D1
  • 7 -------> D2
level - Duty cycle (from 0 to 15)

setSwitchModule

public void setSwitchModule(int outputNumber)
Set the switch module ON

Parameters:
outputNumber - The output connected to switch module

resetSwitchModule

public void resetSwitchModule(int outputNumber)
Set the switch module OFF

Parameters:
outputNumber - The output connected to switch module

readAllSensors

public void readAllSensors()
Reads all sensors. The user can read the sampled data with getSensor1(), getSensor2(),... The intervals of sample can be read with getTimes().

getSensor1

public double[] getSensor1()
Returns sampled data from sensor attached to port 1 in CoachLabII+

Returns:
An array with the sampled data

Returns sampled data from sensor attached to port 2 in CoachLabII+

Returns:
An array with the sampled data

Returns sampled data from sensor attached to port 3 in CoachLabII+

Returns:
An array with the sampled data

public double[] getSensor4()
Returns sampled data from sensor attached to port 4 in CoachLabII+

Returns:
An array with the sampled data

getTimes

public double[] getTimes()
Returns An array with the times of sampled data from sensors

Returns:
An array with the times

outputStatus

public int outputStatus()
Returns a number between 0 and 255 with the current status of the 8 outputs

Returns:
an integer representing the outputs status

command

public byte[] command(int command,
                      int result)
For debugging

Parameters:
command - the commnad to send
result - number of bytes returned from coach
